page.title: 09HAMPTON COURT AND BUSHY PARK
page.content: {Hampton Court is Britain's second {most popular tourist attraction.} It has been estimated that about {3,000,000 people visit the grounds of {the palace each year. }The Palace itself cannot be equalled for those who wish to study at close quarters a tudor mansion or the work of Sir Christopher Wren. The fine paintings and treasures housed in the palace are also an attraction . {There are {reputed to be more than Â£300,000,000 {worth of paintings on display in the {state appartments.} Tourists come from all over the world to Hampton Court and it is heavily used by schools as a teaching resource. {The beautiful {formal gardens are a very popular {local ammenity}and together with Bushy Park provide the local population with an attractive and peaceful venue for walking, jogging and other activities.
